Title: Aqaba Development Company, AG&P to develop onshore LNG import facility in Aqaba
Description: Jordan’s Aqaba Development Company, Singaporean LNG developer AG&P International Holdings and its technology arm GAS Entec Co signed an agreement to develop an onshore LNG import terminal in Sheikh Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Sabah LNG port adjacent to the existing FSRU-based 3.8 mtpa Aqaba LNG terminal.
Author: JS

Title: Thailand’s B.Grimm seen buying more spot LNG in 2025-2027, in talks for term LNG supply
Description: Thai power producer and licensed LNG shipper B.Grimm expects to buy more LNG on a spot basis each year between 2025 and 2027 and has begun discussions to secure long-term supplies for delivery in 2027.
Author: CK

Title: Elengy to resume operations at Montoir LNG following prolonged downtime
Description: French LNG terminal operator Elengy expects to resume operations at its 8 mtpa Montoir facility on Wednesday after prolonged unplanned maintenance that started in mid-June.
Author: JS

Title: PTT seeks two more August-September LNG cargoes after recent purchase for October
Description: Thailand’s state-owned PTT has issued a tender to buy two LNG cargoes for delivery across August and September to the Map Ta Phut LNG terminal in Rayong . The tender closes on Aug. 21.
Author: CK
